member.summary: The HTML tag the targets. A * value indicates this targets all HTML elements with the required .

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.HtmlTargetElementAttribute.Attributes
member.summary: A comma-separated of attribute selectors the HTML element must match for the to run. * at the end of an attribute name acts as a prefix match. A value surrounded by square brackets is handled as a CSS attribute value selector. Operators ^=, $= and = are supported e.g. "name", "[name]", "[name=value]", "[ name ^= 'value' ]".

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.HtmlTargetElementAttribute.TagStructure
member.summary: The expected tag structure. Defaults to .
member.remarks:
If and no other tag helpers applying to the same element specify their the behavior is used:
<my-tag-helper></my-tag-helper> <!-- OR --> <my-tag-helper />
Otherwise, if another tag helper applying to the same element does specify their behavior, that behavior is used.
If HTML elements can be written in the following formats:
<my-tag-helper> <!-- OR --> <my-tag-helper />

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.HtmlTargetElementAttribute.ParentTag
member.summary: The required HTML element name of the direct parent. A null value indicates any HTML element name is allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.TagStructure.Unspecified
member.summary: If no other tag helper applies to the same element and specifies a , will be used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.TagStructure.NormalOrSelfClosing
member.summary: Element can be written as <my-tag-helper></my-tag-helper> or <my-tag-helper />.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.TagStructure.WithoutEndTag
member.summary: Element can be written as <my-tag-helper> or <my-tag-helper />.
member.remarks: Elements with a structure will never have any content.
